blog.author: Brandon W. Kipp
blog.title: Settled In
text: Everything is in its place, and every place has its thing. The last thing I want to do is to spend my entire life
organizing my life. How much originization is really necessary? Enough to put your mind at ease. You can change how much
you let it affect you. You change your response. These walls aren't your home. No walls could ever enclose what you call home.
Life knows no bounds. It cannot be contained. Plants can erode through our best attempts at strength. Plants can hide our strength.
How weird it must be to be an architect. An architect's art is no less permanent than a painting. You can make prints of paintings.
You can make replicas of buildings. The experience can not be felt. Only artists see art. Only artists experience art. Replication
puts us one infinitely long degree away from art. So, what then are we experiencing when we experience a replication?

blog.author: Brandon W. Kipp
blog.title: First Blog Ever
text: So, I guess this is my first blog entry on this site. Today, I moved to Minneapolis all the way from
Wisconsin with the intention of finding a new trail to blaze. For the past five years, I've been running
a tiny recording studio. So many good things had come from that; I met so many creative and talented people.
I got paid to do something I loved. Most importantly, I learned a lot about who I am. Like, that I happen to
love business and finance. Never knew.
